Package userinterface

Class HorizontalSplitPane

java.lang.Object
userinterface.AbstractFrame
userinterface.Pane
userinterface.GenericSplitPane
userinterface.HorizontalSplitPane
All Implemented Interfaces:
DocumentListener
public class HorizontalSplitPane
extends GenericSplitPane
A class extending GenericSplitPane to handle horizontal splitting

  • Field Summary

    • HorizontalSplitPane

      public HorizontalSplitPane​(int x, int y, int width, int height, LeafPane childPane, Pane parentPane) throws IllegalDimensionException
      Initialize this HorizontalSplitPane with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      x - : The x coordinate of this HorizontalSplitPane.
      y - : The y coordinate of this HorizontalSplitPane.
      width - : The width of this HorizontalSplitPane
      height - : The height of this HorizontalSplitPane
      childPane - : the LeafPane child of this HorizontalSplitPane
      parentPane - : the Pane parent of this HorizontalSplitPane
      Throws:
      IllegalDimensionException

  • Method Details

    • handleResize

      public void handleResize​(int newWindowWidth, int newWindowHeight)
      This method handles resizes. It makes sure the HorizontalSplitPane is adjusted in width when the window shrinks or grows. It does not change its height (e.g. look at Firefox).
      Overrides:
      handleResize in class GenericSplitPane
      Parameters:
      newWindowWidth - : parameter containing the new window-width of this HorizontalSplitPane.
      newWindowHeight - : parameter containing the new window-height of this HorizontalSplitPane.

    • drawSeparator

      protected void drawSeparator​(java.awt.Graphics g)
      A method that draws the separator This method is called each time the separator is dragged to a new position.
      Parameters:
      g - : The graphics to be rendered.

    • handleMouse

      public void handleMouse​(int id, int x, int y, int clickCount, int button, int modifiersEx)
      Handle mouseEvents.
      Overrides:
      handleMouse in class GenericSplitPane
      Parameters:
      id - : The type of mouse activity
      x - : The x coordinate of the mouse activity
      y - : The y coordinate of the mouse activity
      clickCount - : The number of clicks
      button - : The mouse button that was clicked
      modifiersEx - : The control keys that were held on the click
